journal-title-group.journal-title: Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics

publisher.publisher-name: American Statistical Association, Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and Interface Foundation of North America

title-group.article-title: Note on "Obtaining the Maximum Likelihood Estimates in Incomplete R Ã— C Contingency Tables Using a Poisson Generalized Linear Model"

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2000 American Statistical Association, Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and Interface Foundation of North America

abstract.p: This note extends the construction of the design matrix used for estimating cell probabilities with ignorable missing data described by Lipsitz, Parzen, and Molenberghs. A reformulation for the general case of an n-way table is described and implemented in a SAS macro program. The macro constructs this design matrix and offset variable, estimates the cell probabilities, and returns a table with the estimates, their standard errors, and fitted cell frequencies.
